intro: Lucuma nervosa, commonly known as the golden fruit or lucuma, is a tropical plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its large, fleshy, yellow-orange fruits that are rich in nutrients. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are small and greenish-white. The fruit is harvested when fully mature, and it is valued for its sweet, nutty flavor and high content of vitamins and minerals.
